column4: is there a software progream to allow someone to SAFELY remotely access your machine?
and you can cut them off whenever you want?
sure, ssh; you can kill the process for their access, using ps -AF
for example: ps -AF | grep <username> will return the process # for their tty
kill that process, and they are disconnected
thank you rdw200169
then again, they can just log in again
rdw so how do i stop them then?
you mean they can continue to access my machine over and over again with my information?
even if i am not here at my computer?
what do you mean?
if i let someone ssh,
can they login when i'm not here?
or do i need to give them access and they can't do it again if i dont?
k
OHH, ok, well, you can set up a quick account, then add that user to the group 'admin'
is there another way i can let someone see my screen then?
without havig to give them access via my wireless router, which i don't have the pasword to?
then they get sudo access, and ssh access, from a different user/pass
what exactly are you trying to do?
give someone access so he can fix something
what are you trying to fix?
